newsitem.title: JAPAN: Nichimen Infinity says to buy back 59,000 shares.
newsitem.headline: Nichimen Infinity says to buy back 59,000 shares.

text.p: Nichimen Infinity Inc, a producer and wholesaler of casual clothes, said on Friday that it would buy back up to 59,000 of its own shares.
The maximum amount to be spent on the repurchase would be 150 million yen, it said.
Nichimen said it would officially decide on the repurchase at its shareholders' meeting on June 27.
Stock options would be offered to nine directors and 22 executives, Nichimen said.
It said a total of 37,000 shares would be offered to directors and 22,000 to executives.
The repurchase would be carried out between April 1, 1998, and March 31, 2002, Nichimen said.
